channel.title: Great way to learn Linux
channel.description: Few weeks ago I ran into this tutorial series of an obviously experienced linux user. It starts assuming you know nothing and is meant to prepare you for Linux Professional Institute's 101 exam, however I find it as a good reference for many things, including inodes, globing, regex introduction, FHS, process control, text processing and even partitioning. "Daniel Robbins is best known as the creator of Gentoo Linux and author of many IBM developerWorks articles about Linux. " [Linux Fundumentals](http://www.funtoo.org/Linux_Fundamentals,_Part_1)

item.title: Great way to learn Linux
item.dc:creator: g3ntleman
item.description:
Few weeks ago I ran into this tutorial series of an obviously experienced linux user. It starts assuming you know nothing and is meant to prepare you for Linux Professional Institute’s 101 exam, however I find it as a good reference for many things, including inodes, globing, regex introduction, FHS, process control, text processing and even partitioning.
"Daniel Robbins is best known as the creator of Gentoo Linux and author of many IBM developerWorks articles about Linux. "
Linux Fundumentals
